title: Soroban Flashcards: Do Kids Actually Need Them?
description: Some soroban programs push flashcards hard. Are they essential or just extra? Here's what actually helps kids learn.

content.intro: When my sons started soroban, I saw recommendations for flashcards everywhere. Special bead pattern cards, speed drill cards, mental image cards. I bought a set. Here's what I learned.

items: **Bead patterns:** A number displayed as soroban beads
**Number recognition:** Flash a pattern, kid says the number
**Speed drills:** Quick flashing for faster recognition
**Anzan prep:** Visualizing patterns without the physical abacus

sections.text: I bought a $25 flashcard set. We used them maybe 5 times total. Here's why:

items: The app already shows bead patterns
Speed drills built into the app are more engaging
Kids found physical cards "boring"
I had to manually track progress vs. automatic in the app
Shuffling, organizing, storing cards = friction
**No-screen practice:** If you're limiting device time
**Car trips:** Easier than a device for some families
**Sibling games:** Older sibling quizzes younger one
**Competition prep:** Some contests use visual flash formats
**Tactile preference:** Some kids like holding physical cards
**Consistent app practice:** 15 minutes daily beats occasional flashcards
**Anzan mode in apps:** Specifically designed for mental visualization
**Real-world questions:** "What's 7+8?" while driving
**Games within the app:** Built-in motivation

sections.text: Save your money. The app provides everything flashcards do, plus instant feedback, progress tracking, and gamification. Flashcards are nice-to-have, not need-to-have.

items: Draw bead patterns on index cards
Focus on numbers your child struggles with
Make it a game, not a drill
Cost: $3 for a pack of index cards + markers

faq.question: Do professional soroban programs use flashcards?
faq.answer: Some do, especially for anzan (mental calculation) training. But modern apps replicate this functionality effectively.

faq.question: Are there digital flashcard apps for soroban?
faq.answer: Yes, but full soroban apps already include this feature. You don't need a separate flashcard app.

faq.question: My child likes flashcards. Should I still buy them?
faq.answer: If your child genuinely enjoys them and will use them, sure. Just don't expect them to replace regular practice on the soroban itself.
